intro: Rhytidosporum, commonly known as the silky everlasting, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers and hairy, silvery foliage. The plants are native to southern Africa and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Rhytidosporum species are typically perennial and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. They are popular in gardens for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
